citation.article-title: Maritalea myrionectae gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a culture of the marine ciliate Myrionecta rubra.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Maritalea myrionectae sp. nov.
Maritalea myrionectae (my.ri′o.nec.tae. N.L. gen. n. myrionectae of Myrionecta rubra, the generic name of the ciliate from which the type strain was isolated).
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
After 3 days on MA plates at 30 °C, colonies are circular, convex, creamy and approximately 1 mm in diameter.
Cells are approximately 0.4–0.5 μm wide and 1.0–2.0 μm long.
Growth occurs at sea salts concentrations of 1–10 % (w/v) (optimum, 2–5 %).
PHB and bacteriochlorophyll a are absent.
Gelatin, starch and Tween 80 are hydrolysed.

According to the API ZYM system, alkaline phosphatase, α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidases, leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, trypsin and valine arylamidase are positive, whereas N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, acid phosphatase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, lipase (C14) and α-mannosidase are negative.

Utilizes l-arabinose, l-arginine, l-asparagine, betaine, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glutamic acid, glycerol, lactose, d-leucine, l-leucine, d-mannitol, mannose, pyuvate, sucrose and trehalose, but not dl-cysteine, dimethylsulfide, glycine, p-hydroxyphenylacetate, maleic acid, succinate or urea as a sole carbon.

Cells are sensitive to (μg per disc) cephalexin (30), chloramphenicol (30), erythromycin (15), gentamicin (10), kanamycin (30), nalidixic acid (30), penicillin G (10) and vancomycin (30), but resistant to streptomycin (10).
In addition to the polar lipids listed in the genus description, minor or trace amounts of phosphatidylethanolamine and an unidentified aminophospholipid can be detected.
The G+C content of DNA of the type strain is 52.7 mol%.
The type strain, CL-SK30T (=KCCM 90060T=DSM 19524T), was isolated from a culture of the marine ciliate Myrionecta rubra.
